pages.title: Block Light Detector
pages.text: Sunlight detectors are relatively imprecise when it comes to measuring light. The Nether Quartz used is so crudely processed that only sunlight can trigger the detector reliably.$(br)Amethyst, on the other hand, is much more sensitive when it comes to measuring light. Even the dim glow of a torch is sufficient to output decent strength.

pages.title: Pedestal Recipe
pages.text: The Light Level Detector does not only react to sunlight, but is also able to pick up other light sources, like from blocks.
